alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 4:32AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as zero to 5 above zero. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Tuesday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM Tuesday to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington; West Baton Rouge
